src:
Ketika Ajax Kena Triple Kill Lawan Chelsea dalam Tempo 60 Detik
06 Nov 2019, 15:06 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Ajax Amsterdam memulai pertandingan dengan sangat baik melawan Chelsea dan sempat unggul lebih dahulu. Namun asa tiga poin itu harus sirna setelah tuan rumah memaksakan skor menjadi imbang 4-4 pada laga yang digelar di Stamford Bridge, Rabu (6/11/2019) dini hari WIB.
Ajax Amsterdam sempat memimpin 4-2 hingga menit ke-63. Namun, ada kejadian selama 60 detik yang mengubah harapan De Amsterdammers. Dua pemain Ajax dihanjar kartu merah hanya dalam tempo 60 detik, yang akhirnya mengubah jalannya laga dan berujung lahirnya dua gol balasan The Blues.
Pelanggaran Daley Blind kepada Tammy Abraham pada menit ke-68 membuatnya mendapat kartu kuning kedua, alias dapat kartu merah. Kemudian sepakan Callum Hudson-odoi pada menit ke-69 mengenai tangan Joel Veltman di kotak penalti yang berujung gol penalti Jorginho.



Veltman pun melayangkan protes yang berakhibat kartu kuning kedua, alias juga kena kartu merah. Tak pelak, Ajax Amsterdam bermain dengan sembilan pemain hingga pertandingan usai.
Keunggulan jumlah pemain berhasil dimanfaatkan oleh tim tuan rumah. Jorginho dan Reece James berhasil menyamakan kedudukan menjadi 4-4, pada menit ke-71 (penalti) dan 74.
Chelsea sebetulnya berhasil mencetak gol kelima. Cesar Azpilicueta mencatatkan namanya di papan skor kedua kalinya dan telah berselebrasi.
Namun, VAR menganulir gol tersebut. Sebelum kapten Chelsea tersebut menendang ke arah gawang Ajax Amsterdam, bola terlebih dahulu mengenai tangan Tammy Abraham.
text:
When Ajax was hit by a Triple Kill against Chelsea in a time of 60 seconds
Nov 6 2019, 15:06 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Ajax Amsterdam started the match very well against Chelsea and got ahead first. But these three points despair should disappear after the host forced the score to be 4-4 in the match that was held at Stamford Bridge on Wednesday (11/06/2019) early morning hrs.
Ajax Amsterdam had a 4-2 lead until the 63rd minute. However, there were 60 seconds of events that changed De Amsterdammers' expectations. Two Ajax players were hit by red cards in just 60 seconds, which eventually changed the course of the match and led to the birth of two goals the Blues replies.
Breach of Daley Blind to Tammy Abraham in the 68th minute earned him a second yellow card, aka getting a red card. Then kick Callum Hudson-odoi in the 69th minute about Joel Veltman's hand in the penalty box that led to Jorginho's penalty.



Veltman also sent a protest that resulted in a second yellow card, aka also hit by a red card. Inevitably, Ajax Amsterdam played with nine players until the match was over.
The advantage of the number of players successfully utilized by the home team. Jorginho and Reece James managed to equalize 4-4, in the 71st minute (penalty) and 74.
Chelsea actually managed to score the fifth goal. Cesar Azpilicueta listed his name on the scoreboard the second time and was celebrated.
However, VAR annulled the goal. Before the Chelsea captain kicked towards Ajax Amsterdam's goal, the ball hit Tammy Abraham's hand first.
